utterance.speaker: Joey

utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.content: Take 'em! Joey, you can touch them! They're your underwear.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That's it! I'm tired of covering for you two! This has got to stop! Ahh! And tighty-whiteys! What are you, 8?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh hey, no, you're not welcome. Okay, look, I hate this! You guys keep embarrassing me! Yesterday, Rachel found your razor in our bathroom and I didn't know what to say, so I said it was mine and-and that I was playing a woman in a play. And one thing led to another and

utterance.speaker: Joey

utterance.content: All this lying has been hard on us too.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh-oh, yeah-yeah, I bet all the sex makes it easier!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, yeah actually.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We'll try to be more careful okay? It's just that, we don't want everyone to know because this is going really well, and maybe the reason it's going really well is because it's a secret.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know it sounds really weird, but we're just so bad at relationships.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We are! Help us!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Help!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right! But, you do it with me once.

utterance.content: Joey!

utterance.speaker: Joey

utterance.content: Hey, Pheebs!

utterance.content: Hey, Pheebs!

utterance.content: What are you reading?

utterance.content: Umm, Wethering Heights. I'm taking a literature class at the New School and I have to finish it for the first session tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I didn't know you were taking a class. That is so cool.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah! Well, I really liked that Lamaze class I took! Y'know and this time I thought I'd go for something, y'know a little more intellectual, with a less painful final exam.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey that sounds like fun.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah! Ooh, you should come with me! Oh yeah, then I'd have someone to sit with!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah! Okay—ooh, but are you going to have time to read it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I read that in high school.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: This is going to be so much fun! Okay-shhh, I have to finish.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What's wrong buddy?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Someone at work ate my sandwich!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, what did the police say?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: My Thanksgiving leftover sandwich. I can't believe someone ate it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ross, it's just a sandwich!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Just a sandwich? Look, I am 30 years old, I'm about to be divorced twice and I just got evicted! That sandwich was the only good thing going on in my life! Someone ate the only good thing going on in my life!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, look, I-I have enough stuff for one more sandwich, I mean I was going to eat it myself, but

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That-that would be incredible. Thank you so much. I-I still can't believe someone ate it!! I mean, look, I left a note and everything.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Knock-knock. Who's there? Ross Geller's lunch. Ross Geller's lunch, who? Ross Geller's lunch, please don't take me. Okay?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'm surprised you didn't go home wearing your lunch.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, look you wanna hold onto your food? You gotta scare people off. I learned that living on the street.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really?! So what would you say Pheebs? Stuff like uh, "Keep your mitts off my grub?"

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Say Ross, when you picture Phoebe living on the street, is she surrounded by the entire cast of Annie?

utterance.content: Okay, this will keep them away from your stuff.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Someday I'll, tell you about the time I stabbed the cop.

utterance.content: Sorry I'm late, but I left late.

utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So Pheebs, what is the book about?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I thought you said you read it in high school.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well yeah, but then I remembered I started it and there was this pep rally and I was, I was on top of the pyramid but anyway—umm, what is this book about?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, umm, it's this tragic love story between Cathy and Heathcliff and umm, it takes place on like these really creepy mores in England. Which I think represents the wildness of Heathcliff's character. I totally get symbolism.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Umm, well I would have to say that it's a, it's tragic love story.

utterance.content: Well, that's sort of a given, but yes. Anyone else?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh-oh-oh, symbolism! And uh, the-the uh, wildness of the mores, which I think is-is mirrored in the wildness of Heathcliff's character.

utterance.speaker: The Teacher
utterance.content: Excellent! What Rachel has shrewdly observed here…

utterance.content: You completely stole my answer!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, honey that was pretty obvious.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well how would you know?! You didn't even read it!

utterance.speaker: The Teacher
utterance.content: What do you think? You in the blue shirt.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I think that uh, yours is a question with many answers.

utterance.speaker: The Teacher
utterance.content: Would ya care to venture one?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Would you care to venture one?

utterance.content: Are you just repeating what I'm saying?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Are you just repeating what I'm saying?

utterance.content: All right, let's move on.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay then.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah but why didn't you just say that you didn't read the book?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Be-because I didn't want him to think I was stupid! I mean, that was really embarrassing what happened to you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe! You're note, amazing! Not only did no one touch my sandwich, but people at work are actually afraid of me. Yeah, a guy called me mental! Mental Geller, yeah, I always wanted a cool nickname like that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, the best you got in high school was Wet Pants Geller.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That was the water fountain! Okay?! Anyway, people are writing reports for me, uh pushing back deadlines to meet my schedule, I'm telling you, you get tough with people you can get anything you want. Hey Tribbiani, give me that coffee! Now!

utterance.content: God, this was really fun! I've been wondering if you were going to ask me out.

utterance.content: No, we just went out.

utterance.content: Oh no-no-no-no, wait-wait-wait!!

utterance.content: Hiya.

utterance.content: Joey, is what she just said umm—Oh my God. You were actually gonna…

utterance.content: You guys promised you'd be more careful! I mean, come on! The good Joey name is being dragged through the mud here!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.content: Oh—I don't know.

utterance.content: Yeah. You see my-my sister makes these amazing turkey sandwiches. Her secret is, she puts a, an extra slice of gravy soaked bread in the middle; I call it the Moist Maker. Anyway, I-I put my sandwich in the fridge over here…

utterance.content: No.

utterance.content: That said it was my sandwich?!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter

utterance.content: You-you-you-you threw my sandwich away!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe

utterance.content: Sorry I'm late. Let's get started. So, what did everybody think about Jane Eyre?

utterance.speaker: Monica

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh-huh. Well, when the psychiatrist told me I had to take a leave of absence because I yelled at my boss I started to get worked up again, so he offered me a tranquilizer. And I thought was a good idea so, I took it.

utterance.content: And you're okay with that?

utterance.content: Ugh, that was so embarrassing! I can't believe you let me go on and on like that!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, yeah! Fun is good, but y'know I also wanted to learn. Y'know, people are always talking about what they learned in high school and I never went to high school.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica, is this true?
